intro: Eclotoripa, commonly known as the golden spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a waxy texture, while the stems are succulent and can store water. Eclotoripa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique foliage.
